title: What is COVID-19, and how serious is it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Novel Coronavirus illness (COVID-19) is a communicable disease caused by a new discovered coronavirus. Infected people with the COVID-19 virus can witness mild to moderate respiratory disease (Just like Pneumonia) and recover while not requiring special treatment. Elderly individuals, and people with underlying medical illnesses like diabetes, respiratory problems and cancer are more vulnerable to coronavirus. To stop the spread of COVID-19 virus and prevent yourself from catching it, you must practise social distancing, wash hands more often and avoid touching your face and nose. The COVID-19 virus spreads through droplets of spittle or discharge from the nose once an infected person sneezes or coughs, so it’s necessary that one must cover one’s mouth and nose (while sneezing or coughing) with a tissue paper and dispose it off properly. At present, there aren't any specific vaccines or treatments for COVID-19. However, trials are under progress. Seriousness: It is impacting human life, economy, animals in the world. It is going to leave its adverse effects on earth. A virus causing severe lung disease that started in China has spread to 27 other countries, including India. Below is the graph which is showing the current situation of the world due to COVID-19.

It’s the new viral disease caused by the novel SARS CoV-19 virus, it causes cough, sneezing, fever, diarrhea, those who are more ill develop a viral pneumonia people can die of, overal mortality in general is 2,3%, higher in males 2,8% than in female 1,7%, higher in the elderly: in those <50 yo <0,5%, in those >80 yo approaching 15%. 80% of those infected aren’t sick, but are infectious anyway, thus makes recognizing who is infected so very, very hard. Infection is by droplets of saliva containing the virus formed when coughing and sneezing, all those who cough and sneeze should wear a simple facemask to prevent saliva droplets from reaching other people.
